Modernizing Poole

State-of-the-art and clean design. Not even Jekyll boast something like this.

Let me be honest here, Poole is not the most innovative and best theme out there. However, it does promise a lot with it’s simplistic design. So I went ahead and took steps even further: I customized it—I essentially made it my own. The design I’m using for this blog is directly taken from Dustin Curtis’ blog. The only similarity is the blunt use of the color black and white, which I think is really the best use for contrasting material you want to stand out. Being a careful typography man, I decided to do research on what the standards are, regarding legibility. The results are what made this site standout. The elegant use of typography creates about 98% of the visual wonders you see here.

This blog is off to a fresh start. The final design is nowhere what you see now. I just wanted to deploy this and keep it up, while I work on a better design offline.
